reviewText: Not a very good display of instruction.  Woman is very hard to follow in the steps she is showing.  Woman doe not speak very well - very hard to understand.  The whole presentation is very poorly "put together"

From what little I can watch of this DVD, I agree with the above viewers.  That being said, I purchased this directly from the instructor, but this DVD skips and freezes on all of my DVD players so I've yet to be able to watch the entire DVD, so who knows?

I purchased this dvd because it was listed as a shimmy instructional. Unfortunately, I have to agree with the last reviewer, the shimmies are in an addition too, not the core curriculum of instruction. Simple combinations are the foremost of the instruction. The combinations are nice, but her own demonstration of the dance movements was not always clear or defined. Consequently, it was confusing, and hard to understand what is being taught most of the time.  As for the shimmies, it did not seem to be her strong point. The instructor didn't seem very sure about the shimmy movements she was teaching, as a result the break down was not always clear.

Unfortunately, I am unable to recommend this one.

FYI: This is the same dvd, as "Belly Dance Total Workout For Body Shaping." I am not really sure why the same dvd material is being marketed under another title and cover?

When I bought it I expected a DVD about all kinds of shimmies and lots of drills but a lot of time is spent on other things too, so it is not a DVD about shimmies, strictly speaking. It is more an introduction to belly dance, including shimmies. Moreover shimmies don't seem to be this dancer's specialty. Instead of this DVD I recommend "1001 shimmies" by Leila Jouvana who is really a shimmy queen.
